nodes.documentation:
@dev Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where
there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to
specific functions.
 * This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier
`onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to
the owner.
nodes.name: Ownable

nodes.documentation: @dev Initializes the contract setting the deployer as the initial owner.
@dev Returns the address of the current owner.
nodes.name: owner

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

arguments.value: Ownable: caller is not the owner

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns true if the caller is the current owner.
nodes.name: isOwner

nodes.documentation:
@dev Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call
`onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.
     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,
thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.
nodes.name: renounceOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
Can only be called by the current owner.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: new owner is the zero address"

arguments.value: Ownable: new owner is the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: new owner is the zero address"

nodes.documentation: @dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).

devdoc.details: Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to specific functions. * This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier `onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to the owner.

constructor.details: Initializes the contract setting the deployer as the initial owner.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
